skill.name: on-call-handoff-patterns
skill.description: Master on-call shift handoffs with context transfer, escalation procedures, and documentation. Use when transitioning on-call responsibilities, documenting shift summaries, or improving on-call processes.
skill.summary: Master on-call shift handoffs with context transfer, escalation procedures, and documentation. Use w...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only static markdown templates and JSON metadata. No executable code, network calls, file access, or environment variable reads. Content matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: On-call transitions often lose context and slow incident response. This skill provides structured handoff templates and checklists to keep teams aligned.
actual_capabilities: Creates full shift handoff documents with active incidents and ongoing investigations
Generates quick async handoffs for brief team updates
Produces incident handoff templates for mid-incident transfers
Delivers pre-shift, during shift, and post-shift checklists
limitations: Does not integrate with PagerDuty, Slack, or ticketing systems
Does not pull live incident data or dashboard metrics
Requires manual editing for dates, owners, and links
Does not enforce organizational policy or approvals

use_cases.title: Weekly rotation handoff
use_cases.description: Create a complete handoff document for incoming engineers with incidents, changes, and upcoming events.

use_cases.title: Mid-incident transfer
use_cases.description: Hand off an active incident with clear current state, actions taken, and next steps.

use_cases.title: On-call process standardization
use_cases.description: Standardize handoff practices with checklists and escalation guidance for new teams.

prompt_templates.title: Basic shift handoff
prompt_templates.scenario: You finished a normal on-call week
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a shift handoff summary with active incidents, ongoing investigations, recent changes, known issues, and upcoming events.

prompt_templates.title: Quick async update
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a short update for chat
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a quick async handoff with TL;DR, watch list, recent changes, and coming up items.

prompt_templates.title: Incident transfer
prompt_templates.scenario: You are handing off a SEV2 incident
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an incident handoff with current state, what is known, actions taken, what needs to happen, and key people.

prompt_templates.title: Process checklist
prompt_templates.scenario: You are onboarding new on-call staff
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a pre-shift, during shift, and post-shift checklist tailored for a platform team.

output_examples.input: Create a quick async handoff for tonight with no active incidents, one ongoing investigation, and a major release tomorrow.
output: TL;DR: No active incidents, one API timeout investigation, major release tomorrow at 14:00 UTC
Watch list: Monitor API latency during backup window, check auth service memory growth
Recent: Deployed api-gateway v3.2.1, increased rate limits to 1500 RPS
Coming up: Database maintenance at 02:00, v5.0 release at 14:00

best_practices: Include next steps and owners for each investigation
Confirm escalation paths and contact availability
Verify alert routing before ending the shift
anti_patterns: Handing off without a written summary
Leaving unclear ownership for active issues
Skipping a sync call when incidents are open

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The content is plain text templates that work in any of those assistants.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not pull live incident data or update tickets automatically.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with PagerDuty or Slack?
faq.answer: Not directly. You can paste the templates into those tools manually.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It contains static documentation and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: What if the output feels too long?
faq.answer: Use the quick async handoff template and limit sections to the essentials.

faq.question: How does it compare to a runbook?
faq.answer: A runbook explains how to fix issues. This focuses on transferring context and ownership.
